page.title: 07100 Years Of Farming
page.content: The Pinguey family have farmed in the village of Cumwhinton for 100 years. In the 1930's 3 men worked on the farm, Mrs.Pinguey did the dairy work and a girl delivered milk, riding a three-wheeled bicycle.They started work at 6.30 a.m. and finished when it was time to go to bed. Every year the stallion was brought to the farm and it was kept there for one night. Mrs. Pinguey worked very hard. As well as doing the work in the dairy , she had to wash all the clothes in a dolly tub and used a poss-stick. Cooking was done on an open fire , the children had to gather fire-wood to keep the oven hot.Flat irons were heated on the stove. At threshing times a steam engine came to the farm to drive the threshing machine, all the men were fed, normally with large helpings of"TATIE POT".
